page.title: 01NEWTOWN NEW FOREST HAMPSHIRE
page.content: An area of undulating moorland heath, small fields and residential houses. Some areas of evergreen, deciduous and conifer trees, and wet land. the areas not privately owned are either Crown land largely kept as a nature reserve or belong to the local Manor. The Forestry Commission who grow, cut and sell timber, administer the Crown Land with the Verderers a seperate body. Agisters look after the cattle and ponies turned out under ancient rights. Animals are also depastured under Manoral rights. Residents are mainly Commoners, small farmers, commutors to nearby towns and retired people. Houses, mainly in the NE corner range from 16th century thatched cottages to present day houses. The former village school is a Rural Studies Centre for children, and the village hall caters for many
